Merge pull request #181 from qchenqizhi/master

Fixed usage of deprecated keys for ParagraphStyle LineSpacing (#181)
Deprecating the library in favor of DTCoreText, as I don't have time to maintain it anymore.

lineSpacing treatment upgrade

kCTParagraphStyleSpecifierLineSpacing
Deprecated. Use kCTParagraphStyleSpecifierMaximumLineSpacing,
kCTParagraphStyleSpecifierMinimumLineSpacing, and
kCTParagraphStyleSpecifierLineSpaceAdjustment to control space between
lines.
https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Carbon/reference/C
TParagraphStyleRef/Reference/reference.html#jumpTo_35

Merge pull request #121 from Infiniverse/master

Ability to activate a link on touchBegin as well as touchEnd.
Make it possible to activate links in the sentence on touchBegin, as well as touchEnd.
Easier and better way to #import <OHAttributedLabel/OHAttributedLabel.h> headers in your app (sorry that changed again, but this time it should be cleaner and work for all possible configurations)
added "setTextItalics:" method + support in Markup Parsers
Added beginEditing/endEditing to methods modifying multiple attributes at once (to optimize consolidation and observers and avoid performing them each time)
Updated README for 3.3.0 (with example usage for OHParagraphStyle, firstLineHeadIndent and lineSpacing)
Updated README for 3.3.0 (with example usage for OHParagraphStyle, firstLineHeadIndent and lineSpacing)
Updated Demo Project to demonstrate new OHParagraphStyle features
Added OHParagraphStyle which allows you do modify a lot of paragraph attributes from line spacing and paragraph spacing (fix #41) to line indentation (fix #109)
Detect bold variant for the ".HelveticaNeueUI" font — It can't find its bold variant by code, but as it is a widely used font (default font in IB) it needed a special hack
Changed colors in UITableView Demo project to show more evidently the formatting

Fix #107 in Demo project : processing markup in attributed string AFTER setting the font of the whole string (to avoid font and color set by markup to be overridden by the following "setFont:" and "setTextColor:")

Merge pull request #108 from jparise/copy-accessor

Respect the attributedText property's 'copy' attribute.

Respect the attributedText property's 'copy' attribute.

attributedText is defined as a copy accessor, so we need to `-copy`
the NSAttributedString's value in `-setAttributeText:`.

Merge pull request #104 from Tomfoolerycorp/vertical_alignment_fix

Apply vertical alignment only if text is smaller than drawing area
only apply vertical alignment calculation if text is smaller than area (if text is too large to fit, don't attempt to center)

Fixed some compilation errors in case we would compile the OHAttributedLabel library with ARC turned ON.

(Note that the OHAttributedLabel library is still compiled with ARC turned off — because I prefer MRC — but this does NOT affect YOUR application's setting (you can turn ARC on or off in your app's xcodeproj) as long as your integrate OHAttribtedLabel as a sibling project of your app's project in your workspace, as explained in the README (don't copy the OHAttributedLabel's .h/.m files directly in your own app's xcodeproj !)

Added "setLink:range:" to NSAttributedString+Attributes so that you can add links directly to the NSAttributedString.
This method is now preferred instead of calling addCustomLink:inRange: on the OHAttributedLabel.
Fix #99 and #55
Code reformatting
Improved TableView Example to show how to manage variable row heights depending on the OHAttributedLabel text size
OHASMarkeupParsers now informs that they in fact return *mutable* attributed strings

Removing Installation & Install Path ; back to importing quoted headers (and not square brackets headers).
This has the disadvantage of forcing the user to add the path to the "Header Search Paths" in his own project's Build Settings, but is more classic and will avoid issues described in #90

Note: Despite being related to fonts, this commit does NOT fix issue 89 (which is due to an Apple bug)

Update README.md

Update README.md

Removed $ForceLoadCategory patch, no longer needed since Xcode 4.2 / LLVM 3.0 fixed the category loading bug.
(see http://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=7431)

Using a recycle pool for sharing NSDataDetector instances across OHAttributedLabel instances, thus reducing the number of NSDataDetector/DDScanner allocations.
Should help fix #86.
Fixed small project issues
Reorganized classes/categories/utility functions in separate files for more readability
Removed iOS6 warnings. Modified the project to create a separate library libOHAttributedLabel.a (to facilitate integration using an Xcode 4 workspace; see example and README)
FIX README to match paragraph orders with the wiki page
Added CHANGELOG
Updated README to add mention of UIAppearance support
Updated READ to add mention of UIAppearance support

Added `linkUnderlineStyle` property for finer underline style control. This property also support UIAppearance proxy

(Note: BOOL properties are not compatible with UI_APPEARANCE_SELECTOR so the `setUnderlineLinks:` can't participate to UIAppearance API, but this new `linkUnderlineStyle` method can)
Added UIAppearance support
Reformatted warnings about known issues
Rearranging demo project files in directories for better organization

Optimization for recomputeLinksInText calls (using the `setNeedsRecomputeLinksInText` method with the same pattern as the `setNeedsDisplay` method avoid to call drawRect multiple times)

This now avoid recomputing links multiple times if we change multiple properties in the same RunLoop iteration. The links will only be recomputed once, and only when needed.

FIX Protocol naming convention. **WARNING** : If you update, don't forget to replace your `-colorForLink:underlineStyle:` delegate method implementations with `-attributedLabel:colorForLink:underlineStyle:`

_(Note: This change is needed to introduce the upcoming UIAppearance support, to return attributedLabel.linkColor in the delegate method when we want to keep the default color, even if this default color is dependent of the UIAppearance proxy default colors you may have set)_
FIX issue #84

Optimization for links computation
(allows better performance especially when setAttributedText is called quite often, which may occur for example inside a UITableView while recycling cells)

Merge pull request #60 from jparise/speed

Various performance improvements.
Merge branch 'master' into speed

Merge pull request #56 from vpatil/master

Accessibility label not being updated when attributed text is set
Correct a broken early-out condition.

Cache the result of the link color selector check.

Previously, we were checking for the selector on every enumeration
block callback.

Avoid copying strings in attributedTextWithLinks.

We don't need to make a local mutable (and autoreleased) copy of our
attributed string in attributedTextWithLinks. Instead, we can operate
directly on our _attributedText ivar.

This change also adds some early-out conditions that let us avoid the
bulk of the processing code when we don't have any links to set.

Defer customLinks allocation.

Previously, an NSMutableArray was always being allocated, even if the
label ultimately had no custom links. This defers the array allocation
until it's actually needed.

Merge pull request #52 from WilliamDenniss/master

Fixes issue where brief touches on a link are ignored

added an additional case to accept the touches for a link, where the end-touch point is less than 10px (in x & y) from the start point.
this fixes an issue where (for some reason) touches on a link are ignored if the touches are very brief.
I believe if you tap a link, it should open the link, even for a brief touch.
typos

Added warning in case bold font does not exist or using unsupported properties

Generalized support for "automatic link detection" to any NSTextCheckingType : now support URL links, but also phone numbers, addresses, etc.
(suggested by issue #32)

( Rollback for commit 5dd7dba9273938dde10f1eeed05a2953fa9e6ba0 )

Added sizeConstrainedToSize:fitRange: method to NSAttributedString+Attributes
(use it quite like UIKit's sizeWithFont:constrainedToSize:lineBreakMode: method)

Merge pull request #27 from ericflo/patch-1

resetting textFrame to NULL in dealloc (not really needed but done anyway for safety reasons)

Fixed a crash caused by dealloc not resetting textFrame to NULL after releasing the reference (a subsequent call to resetTextFrame would pass the if conditional and crash on trying to release the memory.)
